attributes.action: Jacob Rees-Mogg should make an apology to Dr David Nicholl in Parliament
attributes.background: Jacob Rees-Mogg used parliamentary privilege to liken NHS consultant David Nicholl to disgraced anti-vaccine campaigner doctor Andrew Wakefield. His subsequent apology outside of parliament will not be reflected on the record. He needs to apologise on the record.

rejection.details: This would be a matter for Mr Rees-Mogg, rather than the Government or Parliament as a whole.
